newsitem.headline: NOTICE OF SALE - Waldwick, N.J..

text.p: SEALED PROPOSALS will be received by the Chief Financial Officer of the Borough of Waldwick, in the County of Bergen, New Jersey (the
East Prospect Street, Waldwick, New Jersey 07463 on

at 11:00 o'clock A.M. at which time they will be publicly opened and announced, for the purchase of the Borough's $2,565,000 General Improvement Bonds and $420,000 Water Utility Bonds, each issue dated December 15, 1996
(individually, the General Improvement Bonds'' or the
The Bonds comprise two issues of bonds payable on December 15 in each year (without the right of prior redemption) as follows:
$220,000 in each of the years 2001 and 2002,
$230,000 in each of the years 2004 and 2005,
$45,000 in each of the years 2000 to 2004, inclusive.
The combined maturity schedule for the Bonds is as follows:

The Bonds shall be issued in registered form by means of a book-entry system with no physical distribution of bond certificates made to the public. One bond certificate for each maturity of each issue will be issued to The Depository Trust Company, New York, New York (DTC'') and immobilized in its custody. The book-entry system will evidence
ownership of the Bonds in the principal amount of $1,000 or any multiple thereof, with transfers of ownership effected

on the records of DTC and its participants pursuant to and procedures established by DTC and its participants. This Summary Notice of Sale is intended only as a brief summary of the Notice of Sale to be made available to interested persons (the

hereby incorporated herein by this reference thereto. The Notice of Sale and Proposal for Bonds should be reviewed by potential bidders for additional terms and conditions of the sale of the Bonds prior to bidding on the Bonds.

The Bonds will bear interest from their date at a single rate of interest in a multiple of 1/8th or 1/20th of 1% per annum specified by the successful bidder payable on each June 15 and December 15, commencing June 15, 1997, in each year until maturity. The purchase price specified must not be less than $2,985,000 nor more than $2,986,000. Bidders must at the time of making their bids deposit a certified, cashier's or treasurer's check in the amount of $59,700 drawn upon a bank or trust company Borough. The Bonds will be sold to the bidder specifying the lowest rate of interest in accordance with the terms set forth in the Notice of Sale. The Borough will furnish the Bonds and the approving legal opinion of Rogut, McCarthy & Bhend, A Professional Corporation, Cranford, New Jersey, Bond Counsel.
The Bonds will be designated as qualified tax-exem obligations'' for purposes of Section 265(b)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended.

Copies of the Preliminary Official Statement, the Notice of Sale and the Proposal for Bonds are available by contacting the undersigned Chief Financial Officer at the Municipal Building, 15 East Prospect Street, Waldwick, New Jersey 07463 (telephone (201) 652-5858).
By order of the Borough Council of the Borough of Waldwick, in the County of Bergen, New Jersey.
